business.headline: H-1B visa fee hike will disrupt Indian tech ops, 1-day deadline concerning: NasscomNasscom cautioned that Indian nationals employed on H-1B visas will be directly impacted, while technology companies will face disruption in ongoing client projects requiring onshore deployment.

ITR refund delayed? Here's why the process may take longer this yearTax refunds this year are taking longer than usual, leaving many taxpayers waiting and prompting questions about delays, processing times, and what to expect in the weeks ahead.

Why India's insurance market has become a breeding ground for mis-sellingFrom loans tied to unwanted policies to agents chasing fat commissions, insurance policies that were meant to shield families have instead become a trap for many.

Cryptocurrency a bigger challenge to dollar than BRICS currency, says WEF PresidentSpeaking in an exclusive conversation with India Today TV, Brende said de-dollarisation is unlikely in the near term. He added that cryptocurrency is a bigger challenge to the dollar than a potential BRICS currency.

India powers 18% of global growth, WEF chief sees tariff row with US easing soonIn an exclusive interaction with India Today TV, WEF President Borge Brende described India's rapid expansion as a source of "exported prosperity" to the world. "Just imagine what it means for global prosperity. So, you are exporting prosperity by growing so fast," he said.

A widow's wait, a worker's fight: The human struggle behind PF claimsIn Part 2 of our series on the PF claim crisis, we look at why, for so many Indians, withdrawing their own savings has turned into a struggle, forcing them to fight for money that is rightfully theirs.

Will October bring a market breakout? Earnings, GST price cuts fuel hopeAdani stocks led the rally on Thursday following Sebi's dismissal of Hindenburg Research allegations. Experts say this could mark the start of renewed market optimism.
Sensex, Nifty end lower amid profit booking; Adani Group shares gainThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 387.73 points to close at 82,626.23, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 96.55 points to settle at 25,327.05.

Explained: Why Intel shares jumped 22% after Nvidia's $5 billion investmentThe Nvidia-Intel deal not only fuels Intel's stock surge but strengthens its next-gen manufacturing and product integration, creating potential market shifts that could challenge competitors like AMD over the coming years.

Waiting for your ITR refund? Here is how to track itAfter filing your ITR, the next big question is, when will the refund come? Instead of guessing, you can quickly check the progress on the official portal.
Sensex tumbles 500 points: Is the stock market rally over?Around midday, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 471.67 points, settling at 82,542.29, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 130.20 points to 25,293.40.

Does the Income Tax Department delay refunds above Rs 50,000?With the ITR deadline now behind us, many taxpayers are anxiously waiting for their refunds. A common doubt is whether larger refunds, such as those above Rs 50,000, take longer to arrive.

New GST rates from September 22: Why you should double-check product MRPsConsumers must remain alert as new GST rates take effect September 22; checking MRPs carefully ensures savings are realised, avoiding overpayment due to old pricing or retailer confusion.

Adani Power in focus as Sebi clean chit sparks fresh rally in Adani Group stocksAdani Power's move stood out, as analysts see strong momentum beyond the short-term sentiment boost. Global brokerage Morgan Stanley has initiated coverage with an 'Overweight' rating and a target price of Rs 818 per share.

Adani stocks jump up to 10 % after Sebi clean chit in Hindenburg caseThe gains were broad-based across the group's listed entities. Adani Total Gas led the rally, soaring 10% on the BSE. Adani Power climbed 7%, while flagship Adani Enterprises advanced nearly 5%.
Sensex down over 150 points, Nifty below 25,400; Adani Group stocks jumpThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 260.39 points to 82,753.5, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 56.95 points to 25,366.65 as of 9:29 am.

PF transfers to become easier: Here's what's changing for employeesThe Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has now introduced two reforms aimed at tackling these bottlenecks. First, it has launched a Passbook Lite feature within the Member Sewa portal.

EPFO launches Passbook Lite: Check features, how it helps membersUntil now, employees had to log in to a separate Passbook Portal to see details of contributions and withdrawals. With the launch of Passbook Lite, members can now access this information directly on the EPFO Member Portal, using just one login.

Adani Group gets clean chit from Sebi over Hindenburg claimsHindenburg Research had alleged that four Adani group companies lent Rs 6.2 billion ($87.4 million) in 2020, without properly disclosing it in financial statements.
Can you own a credit card without a bank account? Find outYou don't always need a savings account to apply for a credit card; new digital options are changing the rules. Have a look.

Are Fed rate cut and tariff relief setting up a market rally?A softer stance from the US Federal Reserve and the possibility of reduced reciprocal tariffs have lifted investor mood. The big question now: are these triggers enough to set off a sustained rally in Indian markets?

Sensex, Nifty extend rally on US-India trade talk optimismThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 318.97 points to finish at 83,012.68, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 93.35 points to settle at 25,423.60. Broader markets, however, displayed mixed momentum, with several indices ending weaker as profit-booking set in.

US may scrap 25% penal duty on India, cut reciprocal tariffs to 10–15%: CEAChief Economic Adviser V. Anantha Nageswaran indicated that the US reciprocal tariff on Indian goods, currently at 25%, may be reduced to 10–15%.

Missed your ITR deadline? 3 filing options you can still useIf you missed the Income Tax Return (ITR) deadline, don't panic. Taxpayers still have ways to stay compliant and avoid penalties, with three key filing options available even after the due date.

Want to get a loan this festive season? Here's what you can doFrom new clothes and jewellery to family trips and home makeovers, festivals often come with added costs. A personal loan can help bridge the gap, here's a simple guide to getting one this festive season.

iValue Infosolutions IPO opens: Should you consider subscribing?iValue Infosolutions plans to Rs 560 crore through an offer-for-sale of 1.87 crore shares. The price band is set at Rs 284–299 per share, with a minimum investment of 50 shares.

ITR refund 2025: How long will it take to reach you?Millions of taxpayers who filed their returns by the September 16 deadline are now waiting for the next big step, i.e., getting their refunds. But how long does it actually take for the money to land in your bank account?

Why gold loans are no longer just a last resort for borrowersGold loans are shedding their emergency-only image, becoming a mainstream credit choice for urban, semi-urban, and rural India, driven by gold prices, regulation, digital access, and flexible borrowing solutions.

Should investors buy IT stocks right now? Here's what Ventura Securities saysVentura Securities warns of a shift, with US-driven risks mounting, domestic sectors like banking and NBFCs offer a safer path, leaving IT investors to weigh growth against growing uncertainty.

Sensex, Nifty rise on US Fed rate cut; Infosys, Wipro gainThe S&P BSE Sensex gained over 350 points to trade above the 83,000 mark, while the NSE Nifty50 crossed 25,400 in early trade. Broader market indices also saw gains, with volatility remaining stable.

DreamFolks crisis explained: What's going on and what it means for investorsFounded in 2013, DreamFolks acted as a platform connecting banks, credit card companies, and passengers to airport lounges, food services, baggage handling, and other airport amenities.

US Fed cuts rates for 1st time this year. Will it give a boost to Dalal Street?Lower US interest rates tend to make emerging markets like India more attractive to foreign portfolio investors (FPIs), as dollar assets lose some shine and Treasury yields ease.

Urban Company shares register bumper debut on Dalal Street, but what's next?Urban Company's shares, issued at Rs 103, opened at Rs 162.25 and surged as much as 74% during the day. For those who got shares in the IPO, that meant instant profits and a near $3 billion market value for the company.

Ben & Jerry's co-founder quits, accuses Unilever of silencing brand's activismBen & Jerry's co-founder Jerry Greenfield has stepped down from the company after 47 years, saying its independence to speak on social issues has been eroded under Unilever's ownership. Unilever, which is spinning off its ice cream business, thanked Greenfield for his service but disagreed with his claims.

IT, defence or PSU banking: Which sector is likely to see growth on D-Street?PSU banking stocks have started gaining attention after a long period of underperformance, while the IT sector remains in a state of uncertainty.

Sensex, Nifty continue winning run amid India-US trade talk optimismThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 313.02 points to close at 82,693.71, while the NSE Nifty50 added 91.25 points to end at 25,330.25. Broader markets also held their ground, with midcap and smallcap indices finishing in the green.

Business leaders extend heartfelt wishes to PM Modi on 75th birthdayProminent business leaders across India as he celebrated his 75th birthday on Tuesday, with several industrialists praising his transformational leadership and unwavering commitment to the nation's progress.

Want a home loan without the headache? Here's how AI can help youFrom lengthy paperwork to long waiting periods, applying for a home loan often becomes a tedious process filled with red tape, but an AI tool can now make it easy for you.

Cotton farmers face new challenge as quality issues threaten MSPDuring this Kharif season, northern states such as Haryana, Punjab, and Rajasthan, and southern states including Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, experienced prolonged and abnormal rainfall.
Elon Musk congratulates Siddharth Jain, India Inc's 1st executive to own a TeslaElon Musk congratulated Siddharth Jain of INOX Group on owning the first Tesla in India Inc.

entertainment.headline: Malayalam superstar Mohanlal to get Dadasaheb Phalke Award 2023 for contribution to Indian CinemaMalayalam superstar Mohanlal to get Dadasaheb Phalke Award 2023 for contribution to Indian Cinema

Exclusive: Jennifer Aniston wants to come for silent retreat and meditation to IndiaHollywood star Jennifer Aniston shared in an exclusive interview that she wants her next visit to India to be centred on spirituality. She hopes to take part in a silent retreat and experience meditation in India.

Bigg Boss 19: Salman Khan schools Gaurav, Mridul over inactivity, playing safeActor Salman Khan returned to Bigg Boss 19 after missing last week's episode. He schooled contestant Mridul Tiwari for playing too safe inside the reality series.

Are Saiyaara's Aneet and Ahaan dating in real life? Here's what we knowActors Aneet Padda and Ahaan Panday, the lead pair from 'Saiyaara', are reportedly dating in real life. However, they have been advised to keep their relationship private for now.

The Diplomat Season 3 trailer: Keri Russell lands in unexpected political stormThe first trailer for 'The Diplomat Season 3', featuring actors Keri Russell and Bradley Whitford was recently released. The new season promises intense political drama following the death of the president and rising tensions within the British government.

Homebound picked for Oscars: Kareena, Arjun, Ananya and others extend wishesActors Kareena Kapoor, Arjun Kapoor, Ananya Panday, among other celebrities have congratulated the team behind 'Homebound.' The film has been selected as India's official entry for the 2026 Oscars.

Kapil Sharma's Netflix show faces Rs 25 crore lawsuit over Baburao characterProducer Firoz Nadiadwala has issued a legal notice against Netflix for unauthorised use of the Baburao character. The lawsuit highlights serious copyright and trademark violations, demanding removal and apology.

Exclusive: Jennifer Aniston, Reese Witherspoon discuss AI, say it's frighteningActors Jennifer Aniston and Reese Witherspoon discussed AI's impact, labelling it as 'frightening', in an exclusive interview with India Today. Their fourth season of their series 'The Morning Show', addresses AI, deepfakes, and media challenges.

Manoj Bajpayee marks 6 years of The Family Man, shares Season 3 updateAs 'The Family Man' marked six years of release, actor Manoj Bajpayee shared an update on its third season. Directors Raj and DK also expressed gratitude to fans for the success of the series.

Akshay Kumar credits career to stuntmen on The Great Indian Kapil ShowActor Akshay Kumar credited his career's success to stuntmen on 'The Great Indian Kapil Show season 3' finale. He also shared a light-hearted banter with the show's host Kapil Sharma and the rest of the cast as he engaged in playful activities.

Jolly LLB 3 box office day 1: Akshay, Arshad's comedy surpasses Sky Force, Kesari 2Actor Akshay Kumar's 'Jolly LLB 3' opened to a Rs 12.5 crore net collection on day one. The courtroom comedy-drama also features actor Arshad Warsi in a pivotal character.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 27: Abhishek becomes new captain, Baseer-Gaurav clashAbhishek Bajaj is the new captain of 'Bigg Boss 19' house. The actor won the position after a competitive task. In episode 27 of the reality show, a heated argument also erupted between Gaurav Khanna and Baseer Ali.

Ishaan Khatter, Vishal Jethwa call Homebound's India's Oscar entry moment surrealActors Ishaan Khatter and Vishal Jethwa reacted to 'Homebound' getting selected as India's entry for the 98th Academy Awards. The Neeraj Pandey directorial also features actor Janhvi Kapoor in a crucial role.

KBC 17: Contestant Pallavi Niphadkar opens up about undergoing seven miscarriagesPre-primary teacher Pallavi Niphadkar opened up about experiencing seven miscarriages on the latest episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati'. She told host Amitabh Bachchan about her health struggles and shared how adoption brought positivity into her life.

Homebound review: Neeraj Ghaywan's film on caste, faith holds a mirror to societyRelease Date:Fri Sep 26, 2025Homebound review: Director Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' is not just to be watched; it's a heavy, unforgettable cinematic experience that holds up a mirror to a reality you can no longer pretend you didn't know, leaving you with a profound sense of responsibility.

Bollywood's franchise fever: Why filmmakers keep chasing part twos and universesAre you a fan of franchises? Bollywood is hooked on them, banking on them and building universes for box-office wins. Experts from the industry shared why nothing but fresh storytelling can keep the magic alive.

Deepika shares emotional post on 6th collaboration with SRK after exit from Kalki 2Actor Deepika Padukone confirmed her role in Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film 'King' after leaving the 'Kalki 2989 AD sequel'. This move highlights ongoing industry shifts and creative disagreements in major film projects.

Zubeen Garg's final moments before scuba diving accident surface in viral videoAssamese singer Zubeen Garg died at the age of 52 following a scuba diving accident in Singapore. A video of him wearing a life jacket shortly before the tragedy has since gone viral online.

Kiss review: A cheesy romantic fantasy starring Kavin that tugs at your emotionsRelease Date:Fri Sep 19, 2025Kiss movie review: The Tamil film, written and directed by National award-winning choreographer Sathish Krishnan, stars Kavin and Preeti Israni in the lead. 'Kiss' is a breezy romantic film that is worth watching.

general news.headline: India has a weak PM: Congress trains gun on Modi after Trump's H-1B clampdownCongress, led by Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge, criticised PM Modi as a "weak" leader whose foreign policy has failed to protect Indian interests after the US imposed a new $100,000 annual fee on H-1B visas.

No US entry from Sunday unless $100K paid: Trump's disruptive H-1B visa moveUS President Donald Trump signed a proclamation, saying that all H1-B employees, including current visa holders, should pay USD 100,000 (over Rs 88 lakh) every year through their employer or they will be barred from entering the country.

India-US flight fares soar after Trump's H-1B visa move, airports see chaosNew H1B visa rules: H-1B holders in India saw a massive jump in the cost of a direct flight to the US as airlines looked to cash in on the chaos unleashed by US President Donald Trump.

Mohanlal to receive Dadasaheb Phalke Award for contribution to Indian cinemaMalayalam superstar Mohanlal is set to be conferred with the Dadasaheb Phalke Award 2023 for contribution to Indian Cinema. The award will be presented to him at the 71st National Film Awards on September 23.

India's biggest enemy is dependence, says PM Modi amid US tariff, H-1B visa movesPrime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said India's biggest adversary was its dependence on other nations, while urging for self-reliance in sectors from semiconductors to shipbuilding. His remarks came after the US imposed steep tariffs on Indian imports and raised H-1B visa fees drastically.

Cyberattack disrupts flights at London, Brussels and other major European airportsThe incident resulted in significant delays and numerous flight cancellations, impacting thousands of passengers across Europe.

Trump's $100,000 H-1B visa fee is a low blow to IndiaNew H-1B Visa Rules: Just three days ago, Donald Trump wished PM Modi on his birthday, signalling a thaw in ties. Two days later, he revoked the sanctions' waiver for Chabahar Port and imposed a $100,000 fee for H-1B visas. Is Trump playing the classic 'good cop, bad cop' negotiation strategy with India?

University of Bath School of Management: Where Careers Begin With ConfidenceWith students from over 160 countries and a strong alumni network spanning 130 nations, the School creates a community that feels global in reach yet personal in experience.

H-1B visa fee hike will disrupt Indian tech ops, 1-day deadline concerning: NasscomNasscom cautioned that Indian nationals employed on H-1B visas will be directly impacted, while technology companies will face disruption in ongoing client projects requiring onshore deployment.

Why Trump's H-1B crackdown could spark India's talent renaissanceSeveral Indians have lashed out at US President Donald Trump's executive order to impose a USD 100,000 (over Rs 88 lakh) annual fee on H-1B visas, saying the move will "kill" the American economy and boost the Indian economy.

Will Rahul Gandhi's Hydrogen Bomb explode on the Congress?Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's all-out campaign on 'vote chori' and the SIR exercise has raised eyebrows within his own party, with fears it could alienate allies and voters in Bihar. With Gandhi building up the "hydrogen bomb" hype, the Congress faces a dangerous gamble.

Preschool fees soar to lakhs: Are parents paying for toddler education or gloss?Over the past couple of years, viral posts have exposed the steep rise in preschool fees, with parents in cities like Bengaluru, Delhi and Jaipur paying lakhs per year. Once affordable neighbourhood playschools, today's preschools are big business, offering things like robotics kits and glossy facilities, leaving many middle-class families torn between aspiration and financial strain.

Will Saudi step in if there is a war with India? Here's what Pak Minister saidPakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif stated that under a new mutual defence pact with Saudi Arabia, both countries will provide military support if India or any other country launches an attack on either.

Don't know what you mean by rivalry: Suryakumar Yadav unfazed by India vs Pakistan hypeSuryakumar Yadav downplayed India-Pakistan rivalry, focusing on cricket and entertaining fans. Big blow for India? How Trump's killing of Chabahar port waiver will hit DelhiThe US move to end the sanctions waiver given to India for Iran's Chabahar port threatens New Delhi's $500-million investment and its bid to reach Afghanistan and Central Asia, bypassing Pakistan. Donald Trump's decision jeopardises India's first overseas port project and undermines the Chabahar port, the strategic counter to Pakistan's Gwadar port of China.

Super 4 preview: Can Pakistan prove they are second-best Asian team?India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka and Bangladesh have reached the Super 4 stage of the Asia Cup. India are the clear favourites to win the trophy. But who is the second-best side in the competition?

sports.headline: Afghanistan's Noor, Mujeeb reprimanded for breaching ICC Code of ConductAfghan spinners Noor Ahmad and Mujeeb ur Rahman have been handed official reprimands for Level 1 breaches of the ICC Code of Conduct during the Asia Cup Group B clash against Sri Lanka in Abu Dhabi.

Beth Mooney helps Australia equal their highest-ever women's ODI totalBatting stalwart Beth Mooney produced a career-best knock while Georgia Voll and Ellyse Perry struck fluent half-centuries as Australia matched their highest-ever women's ODI total of 412 in the decisive third match against India at the Arun Jaitley Stadium on Saturday.

Asia Cup: Hardik Pandya downplays Pakistan match hype after close win over OmanHardik Pandya advised the team not to think too much ahead of their clash against Pakistan after their win over Oman. India are set to face Pakistan again in the Super 4 stage amid intense expectations.

Pakistan cancel press conference, hire motivational speaker ahead of India clashPakistan cricket team has cancelled their pre-match press conference ahead of their Super 4 match against India in Asia Cup 2025. The team has brought in motivational speaker Dr Raheel Kareem to boost morale before the crucial game.

If Arsenal or Liverpool win Premier League, it's money: Guardiola jibes at City rivalsPep Guardiola took aim at Arsenal and Liverpool ahead of City's Emirates clash, suggesting any Premier League success for his rivals is down to big spending. He stressed, however, that on-pitch performance, not money alone, will ultimately decide the title race.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
